senses.sense_definition: A vertical section of a building showing its internal structure.

examples.text: The architect drew a detailed <w>sciagraph</w> to illustrate the interior height of the nave.
Students examined the <w>sciagraph</w> to understand how the dome was supported.

senses.sense_definition: An image produced on a sensitive plate or film by X-rays or similar radiation.

examples.text: The doctor studied the <w>sciagraph</w> to locate the fracture in the patient's arm.
An early <w>sciagraph</w> revealed the internal mechanism of the antique clock.

traits.comment: usually replaced by radiograph or X-ray

senses.sense_definition: To create a radiograph of an object; to look inside something using X-ray techniques.

examples.text: The technicians <w>sciagraphed</w> the metal components to check for internal flaws.
They decided to <w>sciagraph</w> the mummy without unwrapping it.
